author: Special Correspondent
title: Man who lived with skeleton of sister, found dead
text:
February 21, 2017 14:41 IST Updated: February 21, 2017 14:49 IST more-in Partha De’s body was found in “burning condition” inside a bathroom half a bottle of petrol and matchsticks. 
Kolkata Less than two years after his life and actions came under intense public scrutiny when reports that he was living with the corpse of his sister and two dogs surfaced, 46-year-old Partha De, a software engineer, died under unnatural circumstances here on Tuesday. 
According to police, his body was found in “burning condition” inside a bathroom half a bottle of petrol and matchsticks. The preliminary investigation suggests that he allegedly committed suicide. The body was recovered from a residential apartment located at 15 Wattgunge Street. 
In June 2015, De was rescued from his house in Kolkata upmarket Robinson Street Area. It was the death of Aranbindo De, his father in almost similar circumstances that led to the discovery of the corpse of his sister Debjani De and two dogs with Partha De has been living with six months. The father had allegedly set himself on fire in the bathroom and he police personnel came inside the house to retrieve the body. 
The incident led to lot of curiosity and the several theories floated in media on the mysterious case. DNA tests were conducted on the skeleton after which it became clear that they were remains of Debjani De, sister of the accused who earlier worked as a music teacher in a city school. Amidst extensive media coverage Partha De was taken in police custody. He was later admitted to a state- run mental hospital. He was later released from the hospital. 
In the charge sheet filed by the Kolkata Police in December 2015, Partha De has been charged with trying to tamper to evidence and keeping dead bodies without informing the police. He has been charged with IPC Sections 268 (public nuisance) 269 (negligent act likely to spread infectious disease) along with other sections.
